changes: Changed rosterPosition type from number to string to match actual usage
Confirmed existing properties: isOnMarket, marketValue, potentialStars
Added comprehensive contract and tactical properties
Added startDate?: Date | string (optional to prevent breaking changes)
Added seasonNumber?: number (optional to prevent breaking changes)
Added endDate?: Date | string for completeness
Added text?: string property for GameSimulationUI.tsx compatibility
Confirmed projectedIncome?: number | string already exists with correct type
Type mismatch was usage-related, not interface definition issue

verification.note: Total errors increased due to interface changes, but TS2339 errors decreased as expected

successes: Successfully identified and fixed missing interface properties
Schema-First v2 methodology working - extended root types instead of patching individual files
Property access errors (TS2339) reduced from 412 to 405
Changes were surgical and focused on analysis-identified issues
challenges: Making required fields optional to prevent breaking existing code
Some property access errors may require additional context or usage fixes
Interface extensions can introduce new type constraint errors in other areas
recommendations: Continue with other fix agents to address remaining error types
Monitor for cascading effects of interface changes
Consider usage context when making interface properties required vs optional

nextSteps.immediate: Hand off to other specialized fix agents
nextSteps.strategic: After all fix agents complete, re-analyze to identify remaining property access patterns
nextSteps.coordinate: Check if this is the last fix agent to complete and invoke Loop Coordinator if so

performance.efficiency: Low individual impact but part of systematic approach
